IN THE COURT OF THE JUDICIAL I CLASS MAGISTRATE- V,
(SPECIAL COURT FOR MARK LIST CASES)
THIRUVANANTHAPURAM
Present:-Smt. Aswathy. S, Judicial First Class Magistrate-V,
Thiruvananthapuram.
Monday the 27" day of January, 2025./ 7" Magha, 1946
CC. 287/2020
Complainant : State-represented by the Sub Inspector of Police, Thumba Police
Station in Crime No. 70/2020
(By Assistant Public Prosecutor)
Accused : 1. Arsila, aged 57 years, D/o. Thresia, Thyvilakom House,
Unit No.3, Near Valiyaveli Church, Poundkadavu Ward,
Attipra Village.
2. Likshma @ Greeshma, D/o. Emilda, aged 29 years,
Thyvilakom House, TC. 80/270, Near Kochuveli St.
Joseph Church, Vettucaud Ward, Kadakampally Village.
3. Susy, aged 46 years, D/o. Thresia, Thyvilakom House,
Unit No.3, Near Valiyaveli Church, Poundkadavu Ward,
Attipra Village.
4. Rajani Anil, aged 36 years, D/o. Arsila, Thyvilakom
House, Unit No.3, Near Valiyaveli Church, Poundkadavu
Ward, Attipra Village.
( By Advocate Sri.Nithin Santhosh)
Charge : Offences punishable under sections 341, 294(b), 506(i) and 323
read with 34 of Indian Penal Code, 1860.
Plea : Not guilty
Finding : Not guilty
Sentence/Order : Accused Nos. 1 to 4 are found not guilty of offences punishable
under sections 341, 294(b), 506(i) and 323 read with 34 of
Indian Penal Code, 1860. and they are acquitted of the said
offences under section 255(1) Code of Criminal Procedure.1973.

2 OF7

4. Rajani Anil Attipra Village Thiruvananthapuram

23.01.2025 24.01.2025 27.01.2025 No delay
This case having been finally heard today, the court delivered the following:
JUDGMENT

1. Accused stands trial for offences punishable under sections 341, 294(b), 506(i)
and 323 read with 34 of Indian Penal Code, 1860.

2. Prosecution case in brief is as follows:- Due to the prior enmity, accused
nos. 1 to 4, on 17.01.2020, at 17.30 hours, at the compound of Thyvilakom
House, Valiyaveli Junction, South Thumba — Valiyaveli road, Poundukadavu
Ward, Attipra Village, the house of accused no.1 uttered obscene words against
CW1, accused no.2 hit on her back, thereafter accused no.3 and 4 hit on her
body. It is alleged that when CW2 and CW3 intervened, the accused nos. 1 to

3 OfF7
4 assaulted them. Thus the accused persons have committed offences
punishable under sections 341, 294(b), 506(i) and 323 read with 34 of Indian
Penal Code, 1860.

3. Final report was filed before this court by the Sub Inspector of police Thumba
police station and the case was taken on file as CC. 287/2020. Cognizance was
taken for the offences punishable under sections. 341, 294(b), 506(i) and 323
read with 34 of Indian Penal Code, 1860.

4. On appearance of accused Nos. 1 to 4 they were enlarged on bail on
05.04.2024. On their appearance relevant records of prosecution were served
ws. 207 of Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973. Particulars of offences
punishable under sections 341, 294(b), 506(i) and 323 read with 34 of Indian
Penal Code, 1860 read over and explained to the accused Nos. 1 to 4 to which
they pleaded not guilty and claimed to be tried.

5. On the side of prosecution, PW1 and PW.2 were examined and Exhibit. P1 was
marked. As the material witnesses failed to support the prosecution case, the
learned Assistant Public Prosecutor gave up the CW3 to CW7. In the absence
of any incriminating circumstances against the accused persons questioning of
the accused Nos. 1 to 4 , under section 313(1)(b) of Code of Criminal
Procedure, 1973 was dispensed with. Accused Nos. 1 to 4 were called upon

4 Of7
to adduce evidence but no defence evidence was adduced from the side of the
accused Nos. i to 4.
6. Heard both sides.
7. Points that arose for consideration are as follows:-

1. Whether on 17.01.2020, at 17.30 hours, at the compound of Thyvilakom
House, Valiyaveli Junction, South Thumba -— Valiyaveli road,
Poundukadavu Ward, Attipra Village, accused Nos. 1 to 4 infurtherance of
their common intention, accused Nos.1 to 4 wrongfully restrained PW1 and
thereby committed offence punishable under section 341 r/w. 34 of Indian
Penal Code, 1860?

2. Whether on the same day, at same time and place infurtherance of common
intention of accused Nos. 1 to 4, accused no.1 among them uttered obscene
words towards PWi and thereby committed offence punishable under
section 294(b) r/w. 34 of Indian Penal Code, 1860?

3. Whether on the same day, at same time and place accused Nos. 1 to 4 in
furtherance of their common intention threatened PW1 and thereby
committed an offence punishable w/s. 506(i) r/w. section 34 of Indian Penal
Code, 1860 ?

4, Whether on the same date at same time and place, accused Nos. 1 to 4
infurtherance of their common intention, accused No.2 hit on PW1’s
shoulder with her hands, accused nos. 3 and 4 hit on various parts of
PW1’s body and assaulted PW2 and CW3 and thereby committed offence
punishable under section 323 r/w. 34 of Indian Penal Code 1860?

5 Of 7
5. If the accused Nos. 1 to 4 are found guilty? What is the order as to
sentence?

8. Point Nos. 1 to 4 :-To avoid repetition and for brevity, points are considered
together. Prosecution case is that the accused Nos. 1 to 4 have committed
offences punishable under sections 341, 294(b), 506(i) and 323 read with 34 of
Indian Penal Code, 1860.

9. PW1, Violet admitted her signature in the Ext P 1 statement .She deposed that
she has no grievance against the accused persons ,in fact the accused persons
have not assaulted her .According to her she had not sustained any injury by
the alleged incident and she is not intending to proceed with the case. Further
she deposed that the incident was not witnessed by any others.

10.PW2, Arunima deposed that CW1 is her mother in law and she has no
grievance against the accused persons and she is not intend to proceed with this
case. According to her accused nos. 1 to4 didn’t assault her.

11. Learned Assistant Public Prosecutor has given up the other witnesses in this
case and he is justified in doing so as the material witness failed to support the
prosecution case. There is nothing on record to disclose that the accused Nos. 1
to 4 have committed the offences as alleged by the prosecution. Having

6 Of 7
considered the evidence on record, this court is of the view that the
prosecution has failed to prove the guilt of the accused persons and for the said
reasons, these points are found against the prosecution.

12. Point No. 5 :- Upon the findings in Point Nos. 1 to 4, the accused Nos. 1 to 4
are found not guilty of offences punishable under sections 341, 294(b), 506(i)
and 323 read with 34 of Indian Penal Code, 1860 and they are acquitted of the
said offences under section 255(1) Code of Criminal Procedure.1973. Their
bail bonds stands cancelled and they are set at liberty.

No material objects are produced in this case.
Dictated to the Confidential Assistant, transcribed and typed by her, corrected by me
and pronounced in the open court on this the 27" day of January, 2025.
Sd/-
Judicial I Class Magistrate-V,
Thiruvananthapuram.
